claim: People who died during the construction of Hoover Dam had their bodies removed no bodies are buried in it.

supporting.text: Historical records confirm that all workers who died during the construction of Hoover Dam were recovered and their remains were returned to their families or buried elsewhere.

attacks.text: Historical records confirm that all workers who died during the construction of Hoover Dam were recovered and their remains were returned to their families or buried elsewhere.

Official construction logs and government reports from the era meticulously documented fatalities and recoveries, making it unlikely any bodies were left unaccounted for.
Urban legends and local folklore persist about workers being buried in the dam, casting doubt on the completeness of historical records.
Folklore lacks credible evidence and is contradicted by verified documentation from the Bureau of Reclamation and contemporary news reports.
